001package io.github.ai4ci.config.setup;
002
003import org.immutables.value.Value;
004
005import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonDeserialize;
006import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonSerialize;
007
008import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ModifiablePerson;
009import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak;
010import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person;
011import io.github.ai4ci.util.Conversions;
012import io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler;
013
014/**
015 * Location aware demographic configuration.
016 *
017 * <p>
018 * This interface provides simple helpers for demographies that incorporate
019 * spatial information. It defines a proximity based modifier and utility
020 * methods used during setup and relationship strength calculation.
021 * Implementations are used by the model builder during the setup stage to place
022 * people and to inform contact probabilities between agents.
023 *
024 * <p>
025 * Downstream uses include
026 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultModelBuilder#setupOutbreak}
027 * during outbreak construction and the per‑person baseliner which may consult
028 * proximity when assigning household or workplace links.
029 *
030 * <p>
031 * Extension guidance: subclasses may override {@link #getRelationshipStrength}
032 * to combine alternative spatial kernels or to use data driven lookup tables.
033 * Keep heavy data loads in the setup stage rather than per‑person methods.
034 *
035 * @author Rob Challen
036 */
037@Value.Immutable
038@JsonSerialize(as = ImmutableLocationAwareDemography.class)
039@JsonDeserialize(as = ImmutableLocationAwareDemography.class)
040public interface LocationAwareDemography extends DemographicConfiguration {
041
042        /**
043         * Sensible default configuration for location aware demography used in
044         * examples and tests.
045         */
046        public static ImmutableLocationAwareDemography DEFAULT = ImmutableLocationAwareDemography
047                        .builder().setContactProximityBias(2.0).build();
048
049        /**
050         * Create a minimal person stub attached to the supplied outbreak.
051         *
052         * <p>
053         * Used by setup helpers that need a quick person object for sampling or
054         * placement. Implementations may extend the returned stub further in later
055         * stages.
056         *
057         * @param outbreak owning outbreak used to attach the created person
058         * @return a modifiable person stub
059         */
060        @Override
061        default ModifiablePerson createPersonStub(Outbreak outbreak) {
062                ModifiablePerson tmp = Person.createPersonStub(outbreak);
063                return tmp;
064        }
065
066        /**
067         * Calibrates the strength of association between distance and contact
068         * probability. Values above 1 compress contact radius; values below 1 expand
069         * it.
070         *
071         * @return proximity bias applied to base contact odds
072         */
073        Double getContactProximityBias();
074
075        /**
076         * Compute a relationship strength between two people based on spatial
077         * proximity.
078         *
079         * <p>
080         * The returned value is an odds/probability modifier used by higher level
081         * code when composing demographic and location based contact modifiers.
082         * Implementations that need alternative kernels should override this method.
083         *
084         * @param source  the source person
085         * @param target  the target person
086         * @param sampler a sampler for stochastic sampling when required
087         * @return a relationship strength used as an odds modifier
088         */
089        @Override
090        default public double getRelationshipStrength(
091                        Person source, Person target, Sampler sampler
092        ) {
093                return Conversions.scaleProbabilityByOR(
094                                this.getProximity(source, target),
095                                1 / this.getContactProximityBias()
096                );
097        }
098
099}
